items.text: Disable Azure Container Registry image export
items.description: Disable image export to prevent data exfiltration. Note that this will prevent image import of images into another ACR instance.
items.query: resources | where type =~ 'Microsoft.ContainerRegistry/registries' | extend acrName = name, acrId = id | extend exportPolicyStatus = properties.policies.exportPolicy.status | extend compliant = iif(exportPolicyStatus =~ 'Disabled', true, false) | project acrName, acrId, exportPolicyStatus, compliant

items.text: Enable Azure Policies for Azure Container Registry
items.description: Enable audit compliance visibility by enabling Azure Policy for Azure Container Registry

items.text: Sign and Verify containers with notation (Notary v2)
items.description: The Azure Key Vault (AKV) is used to store a signing key that can be utilized by?notation?with the notation AKV plugin (azure-kv) to sign and verify container images and other artifacts. The Azure Container Registry (ACR) allows you to attach these signatures using the?az?or?oras?CLI commands.

items.text: Encrypt registry with a customer managed key
items.description: Azure Container Registry automatically encrypts images and other artifacts that you store. By default, Azure automatically encrypts the registry content at rest by using service-managed keys. By using a customer-managed key, you can supplement default encryption with an additional encryption layer.
items.graph: resources | where type =~ 'Microsoft.ContainerRegistry/registries' | extend acrName = name, acrId = id | extend encryptionStatus = properties.encryption.status  | extend compliant = iif(encryptionStatus == 'disabled', false, true) | project acrName, acrId, encryptionStatus, compliant

items.text: Use Managed Identities to connect instead of Service Principals
items.description: Use managed identities to secure ACRPull/Push RBAC access from client applications

items.text: Disable local authentication for management plane access
items.description: The local Administrator account is disabled by default and should not be enabled. Use either Token or RBAC-based access methods instead
items.graph: resources | where type =~ 'microsoft.containerregistry/registries' | extend localAdminDisabled = properties.adminUserEnabled // Adjust this property as needed | extend compliant = iif(localAdminDisabled == 'false', true, false) // Check if local admin is disabled | project compliant, name, id, tags | distinct id, compliant

items.text: Assign AcrPull & AcrPush RBAC roles rather than granting Administrative access to identity principals
items.description: Disable Administrator account and assign RBAC roles to principals for ACR Pull/Push operations
items.graph: resources | where type =~ 'microsoft.containerregistry/registries' | extend localAdminDisabled = properties.adminUserEnabled // Adjust this property as needed | extend compliant = iif(localAdminDisabled == 'false', true, false) // Check if local admin is disabled | project compliant, name, id, tags | distinct id, compliant

resources | where type =~ 'microsoft.containerregistry/registries' | extend compliant = iif(properties.anonymousPullEnabled == false, true, false) | project compliant, name, id, tags | distinct id, compliant

items.description: Token authentication doesn't support assignment to an AAD principal. Any tokens provided are able to be used by anyone who can access the token

items.text: Deploy images from a trusted environment
items.description: Deploy container images to an ACR behind a Private endpoint within a trusted network

items.text: Disable Azure ARM audience tokens for authentication
items.description: Only tokens with an ACR audience can be used for authentication. Used when enabling Conditional access policies for ACR

Set up a diagnostic setting to send 'repositoryEvents' & 'LoginEvents' to Log Analytics as the central destination for logging and monitoring. This allows you to monitor control plane activity on the ACR resource itself.

items.text: Control inbound network access with Private Link
items.description: Service supports disabling public network access either through using service-level IP ACL filtering rule (not NSG or Azure Firewall) or using a 'Disable Public Network Access' toggle switch
Disable public network access if inbound network access is secured using Private Link
items.graph: resources | where type =~ 'Microsoft.ContainerRegistry/registries' | where sku.name =~ 'Premium' // Check for Premium SKU | extend publicAccessEnabled = properties.publicNetworkAccess | extend defaultAction = tostring(properties.networkRuleSet.defaultAction) // Extract defaultAction | extend compliant = iif(publicAccessEnabled != 'Enabled' or defaultAction == 'Deny', true, false) | project name, id, publicAccessEnabled, defaultAction, compliant

items.text: Use an Azure Container Registry SKU that supports Private Link (Premium SKU)
items.description: Only the ACR Premium SKU supports Private Link access
items.graph: resources | where type =~ 'Microsoft.ContainerRegistry/registries' | extend skuName = sku.name // Extract the SKU name | extend compliant = iif(skuName == 'Premium', true, false) // Check if SKU is Premium | project name, id, skuName, compliant

items.text: Enable Defender for Containers to scan Azure Container Registry for vulnerabilities
items.description: Azure Defender for containers or equivalent service should be used to scan container images for vulnerabilities
Deploy trusted code that was validated and scanned for vulnerabilities according to DevSecOps practices.

items.text: Use up-to-date platforms, languages, protocols and frameworks
items.description: Use the latest versions of supported platforms, programming languages, protocols, and frameworks.
